member.name: T:Cuemon.Alphanumeric
member.summary: Provides a set of alphanumeric constant and static fields that consists of both letters, numbers and other symbols (such as punctuation marks and mathematical symbols).

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.Numbers
member.summary: A representation of a numeric character set consisting of the numbers 0 to 9.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.UppercaseLetters
member.summary: An uppercase representation of an alphabetic character set consisting of the letters A to Z.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.Letters
member.summary: A case sensitive representation of an alphabetic character set consisting of the letters Aa to Zz.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.LettersAndNumbers
member.summary: A case sensitive representation of an alphanumeric character set consisting of the numbers 0 to 9 and the letters Aa to Zz.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.LowercaseLetters
member.summary: A lowercase representation of an alphabetic character set consisting of the letters a to z.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.PunctuationMarks
member.summary: A representation of the most common punctuation marks consisting of the characters !@#$%^&*()_-+=[{]};:<>|.,/?`~\"'..

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.WhiteSpace
member.summary: A representation of the most common whitespace characters.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.Hexadecimal
member.summary: A representation of a hexadecimal character set consisting of the numbers 0 to 9 and the letters A to F.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.NetworkPathReference
member.summary: A network-path reference, eg. two forward slashes (//).

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.NewLine
member.summary: Carriage-return/linefeed character combination.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.Tab
member.summary: Tab character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.TabChar
member.summary: Tab character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.Linefeed
member.summary: Linefeed character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.LinefeedChar
member.summary: Linefeed character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.CarriageReturn
member.summary: Carriage-return character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.CarriageReturnChar
member.summary: Carriage-return character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.Caret
member.summary: Circumflex accent / Caret character.

member.name: F:Cuemon.Alphanumeric.CaretChar
member.summary: Circumflex accent / Caret character.

member.name: T:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator
member.summary: Defines the most common assignment operators for numeric operands.
member.remarks: For more information please refer to this Wikibooks article: http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/C_Sharp_Programming/Operators.

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Assign
member.summary: An assignment operation, such as (x = y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Addition
member.summary: An addition compound assignment operation, such as (x += y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Subtraction
member.summary: A subtraction compound assignment operation, such as (x -= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Multiplication
member.summary: A multiplication compound assignment operation, such as (x *= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Division
member.summary: An division compound assignment operation, such as (x /= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Remainder
member.summary: An arithmetic remainder compound assignment operation, such as (x %= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.And
member.summary: A bitwise or logical AND compound assignment operation, such as (x &= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.Or
member.summary: A bitwise or logical OR compound assignment, such as (x |= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.ExclusiveOr
member.summary: A bitwise or logical XOR compound assignment operation, such as (x ^= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.LeftShift
member.summary: A bitwise left-shift compound assignment, such as (x <<= y).

member.name: F:Cuemon.AssignmentOperator.RightShift
member.summary: A bitwise left-shift compound assignment, such as (x >>= y).

member.name: T:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix
member.summary: Defines a binary unit prefix for multiples of measurement for data that refers strictly to powers of 2. This class cannot be inherited.

member.summary: Gets the binary-multiple prefix kibi (symbol 'Ki'), 2^10 = 1024.
member.value: The binary-multiple prefix kibi (symbol 'Ki').

member.name: P:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix.Mebi
member.summary: Gets the binary-multiple prefix mebi (symbol 'Mi'), 2^20 = 1048576.
member.value: The binary-multiple prefix mebi (symbol 'Mi').

member.name: P:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix.Gibi
member.summary: Gets the binary-multiple prefix gibi (symbol 'Gi'), 2^30 = 1073741824.
member.value: The binary-multiple prefix gibi (symbol 'Gi').

member.name: P:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix.Tebi
member.summary: Gets the binary-multiple prefix tebi (symbol 'Ti'), 2^40 = 1099511627776.
member.value: The binary-multiple prefix tebi (symbol 'Ti').

member.name: P:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix.Pebi

member.name: P:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix.Exbi

member.name: P:Cuemon.BinaryPrefix.Zebi
member.summary: Gets the binary-multiple prefix zebi (symbol 'Zi'), 2^70 = 1180591620717411303424.
member.value: The binary-multiple prefix zebi (symbol 'Zi').

member.name: M:Cuemon.Condition.IsGuid(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified has a valid format of a .
member.param: The string to verify has a valid format of a .
member.returns: true if the specified has a format of a ; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
This implementation only evaluates for GUID formats of: | | , eg. 32 digits separated by hyphens; 32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in brackets and 32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses.
The reason not to include , eg. 32 digits is the possible unintended GUID result of a MD5 string representation.

member.param: The instance of an to convert.
The which may be configured.
member.returns: A that represents the specified .
member.remarks: When determining the representation of the specified , these default rules applies: 1: if the method has been overridden, any further processing is skipped (the assumption is, that a custom representation is already in place) 2: any public properties having index parameters is skipped 3: any public properties is appended to the result if has not been overridden Note: do not call this method from an overridden ToString(..) method without setting to true; otherwise a will occur.

member.summary: Specified any of the supported GUID formats (N,D,B,P,X).

member.name: M:Cuemon.Runtime.Watcher.StartMonitoring
member.summary: Starts the timer that will monitor this implementation.

members.member:
Changes the signaling timer of the .
A representing the amount of time to delay before the starts signaling. Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to prevent the signaling from starting. Specify zero (0) to start the signaling immediately. If is zero (0), the signaling is started immediately. If is negative one (-1) milliseconds, the signaling is never started; and the underlying timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by specifying a positive value for .

member.name: M:Cuemon.Runtime.Watcher.ChangeSignaling(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Changes the signaling timer of the .
member.param: A representing the amount of time to delay before the starts signaling. Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to prevent the signaling from starting. Specify zero (0) to start the signaling immediately.
The time interval between periodic signaling. Specify negative one (-1) milliseconds to disable periodic signaling.
member.remarks: If is zero (0), the signaling is started immediately. If is negative one (-1) milliseconds, the signaling is never started; and the underlying timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by specifying a positive value for . If is zero (0) or negative one (-1) milliseconds, and is positive, the signaling is done once; the periodic behavior of the underlying timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by specifying a value greater than zero for .

member.summary: Validates and throws an if the specified has the format of a .
member.param: The value to be evaluated.
The name of the parameter that caused the exception.
member.remarks:
This implementation only evaluates for GUID formats of: | | , eg. 32 digits separated by hyphens; 32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in brackets and 32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses.
The reason not to include , eg. 32 digits is the possible unintended GUID result of a MD5 string representation.
